stories.text:
1.in order to have a decent functioning dating app, you should make the guys pay monthly fee.

2.have a very solid sign up process for both men and women, tie their actual identity to the profile. name, picture, job, income, background check etc

3.have a filter system based on age, race, height, weight, job, etc (options for this filter is limitless to a point where even same genders can use it to find friends.)

4.maybe add ratings, 1-5 star for after date, to show if the experience was pleasant or horrible. although i think this one can get abused.

5.profits for this app comes from only subscriptions that the guys are paying. rather then focusing on a algorithm to force people to come back and continue compulsive swiping.

I have no interest in making this app, i just want to know if you think this would make online dating more functioning/better experience, or did i just listed a series of awful ideas?
stories.title: Interesting Ideas for a Dating App

stories.text: There's a path/road marked on google maps that cuts directly through my private property. It is not an actual road and I have found people trying to drive through it after seeing it on the app. I've made dozens of edit requests over the years to have it removed but google has not taken action or responded. Any tips?
stories.title: How to get Google Maps to take action on report?
From the Great Resignation to Lying Flat, Workers Are Opting Out
